onyomiExamples.meaning: ulterior motive, plot, scheme, complicated circumstances, intricacies
repose of a soul, ceremony for the repose of a departed soul
putting one's heart and soul (into), giving one's all, breathing a soul into (e.g. a Buddhist statue), intimacy, familiarity

kunyomiExamples.meaning: soul, spirit, mind, willpower, vitality, something as important as one's own life, something invaluable, inherent spirit of something, state of mind
(theory of) the immortality of the soul

kunyomiExamples.example: 一寸の虫にも五分の魂
kunyomiExamples.reading: いっすんのむしにもごぶのたましい
kunyomiExamples.meaning: tread on a worm and it will turn, even a tiny bug will defend itself, even the weakest and smallest beings have their own wills, so do not make light of them
Dead Souls (novel by Gogol), Myortvye dushi
soul, spirit, mind, willpower, vitality, something as important as one's own life, something invaluable, inherent spirit of something, state of mind
sending off the spirits of the dead
